channel.title: Proxy as infinite login attempts?
channel.description: I have a bunch of these accounts I have had the passwords changed to one of a few, but the point when login attempts are denied create fast this block on attempts, but this made me wonder.. Would I be allowed infinite attempts through a proxy when changing the IP used? I see no reason why this wouldn't work, and to know for sure, I will try this theory.. Will update in a few!

item.title: Proxy as infinite login attempts?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Kozs, post:4, topic:522198”][quote author=Jmood link=topic=640705.msg4317484#msg4317484 date=1371734764]
Yes you can use a Proxy to keep attempting, but we don’t condone this type of activity here.
[/quote]

What ya? a cop?[/quote]
Interweb police here.

Moparisthebest:

7. No discussion of account hacking or recovering. If it isn’t yours, don’t take it.

From what I pick up you could just as easily be trying to take someone else account through guessing their password, if you’ve forgotten yours use Jagex’s account recovery tool. Just for anyone else wondering if Jagex didn’t store login attempts to an account ID and as an IP instead they should be shot.

Read full topic
